contentrichtext.text: [[Image:1stLordMerrivale.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Henry Duke, <br>1st Baron Merrivale.]] '''Baron Merrivale''', of [[Walkhampton]] in the County of Devon, is a title in the [[Peerage of the United Kingdom]]. It was created in 1925 for the [[Conservative Party (UK)|Conservative]] politician and judge of the [[High Court of Justice]], [[Henry Duke, 1st Baron Merrivale|Sir Henry Duke]]. {{As of|2010}} the title is held by his great-grandson, the fourth Baron, who succeeded his father in 2007. ==Barons Merrivale (1925)== *[[Henry Duke, 1st Baron Merrivale|Henry Edward Duke, 1st Baron Merrivale]] (1855–1939) *Edward Duke, 2nd Baron Merrivale (1883–1951) *Jack Henry Edmond Duke, 3rd Baron Merrivale (1917–2007) *Derek John Philip Duke, 4th Baron Merrivale (b. 1948) ==Notes== {{unreferenced|date=February 2013}} {{reflist}} ==References== *Kidd, Charles, Williamson, David (editors). ''Debrett's Peerage and Baronetage'' (1990 edition). New York: St Martin's Press, 1990, {{Page needed |date=February 2013}} *{{Rayment|date=February 2012}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Merrivale}} [[Category:Baronies in the Peerage of the United Kingdom]]
